title: YuzuMisoTopping&Spread
description:
Combining two iconically Japanese ingredients into one uniquely delicious sauce, Trader Joe’s Yuzu Miso Topping & Spread is a curiously captivating condiment, unlike any other we’ve offered before. On tasting it, you’ll likely first notice its rich, luxuriously thick consistency, then the savory, umami-filled notes of its white miso paste base, which perfectly leads into the pleasantly tart tones of its mixed-in yuzu zest and yuzu juice. Then, once you’ve had a chance to take it all in, the elegant balance between its savory and citric elements ought to immediately inspire you with all the possibilities for where you can use it..
Read More

title: ApricotCardamomSpread
description:
With its pungent, peppery warmth, complex floral notes, and zesty hints of citrus, it’s no surprise that cardamom is currently enjoying a moment in the culinary spotlight. In keeping with that spirit of sweetly spiced exploration of flavor, our product developer worked with a Belgian supplier known for their high quality fruit spreads to craft the newest, limited-edition addition to our grocery shelves, just in time for summer. Introducing Trader Joe’s Apricot Cardamom Spread!
Read More

title: CrunchyJicamaSlaw
description:
When you have a crisp cadre of fresh-cut veggies, paired with a flavorful dressing, who can be against the slaw? In the case of Trader Joe’s Crunchy Jicama Slaw, that truly a root-torical question!
Our Slaw comes from Mexico, like the original Jicama root itself. Jicama “noodles” make up the base of this salad, with julienned carrots and diced radishes, cucumbers, and red bell peppers. The addition of shelled edamame brings a bit of protein to the party—3g per one-cup serving, to be precise.
Read More

title: SimplyAmazingSoftDriedApricots
description:
Large, Dried Apricots—of the juicy, Suphany variety—ripen in the sun to a blush-orange hue, while also developing a rich, honey-like sweetness. Once harvested, they’re carefully dried in the summer sun by our trusted Turkish apricot supplier (and by Mother Nature, of course). What really makes these Dried Apricots Simply Amazing is the final step, which involves a gentle steaming. This unique method yields unbelievably Soft Apricots with a tender, chewy, almost velvety texture. Each bite of these reddish gems presents a floral, candy-like quality that is tempered by a pleasant tang.
Read More

title: CarrotMiniSheetCake
description:
Whose idea was it to put carrot in a cake anyway? In Medieval Europe, sugar was so inaccessible that the populace had to get creative with satisfying its sweet tooth. Abundant in quantity and sufficiently sweet, carrots got the job done—and then some. Not only did they contribute understated sweetness; they also increassed moisture content to keep desserts fluffy. Taking notes from both Medieval masses and grandmas of yore, Trader Joe’s festively spiced Carrot Mini Sheet Cake evokes nostalgia with every bite.
Read More

title: CrackerAssortment
description:
The big party is approaching. The plans are set, the food is nearly ready, but something is missing, something that will tie together all the disparate culinary creations that come to the table. That certain something that will make the cheeses cheesier, the dips more dippable, and the spreads more spreadable. It’s the crackers. Face it: without the right crackers, all will be lost. And “all will be lost” does not make for a happy happening. Every party is saved with the addition of Trader Joe’s Cracker Assortment.
Read More

title: CaesarSaladwithWhiteChickenMeat
description:
Hail, Caesar Salad! Since its invention in the 1920s, the Caesar has reigned supreme as a scion of salad- dom — although, full disclosure, it actually gets its name from its reported inventor, chef Caesar Cardini; any similarities to Roman emperors are purely coincidental. And for close to three decades, Trader Joe’s Caesar Salad with Chicken has remained a staple of our salad selection. Inspired by the classic recipe, it’s made with crisp Romaine lettuce, fresh shreds of Parmesan, crunchy croutons, and tender chunks of chicken breast, with a packet of zesty, creamy, and triumphantly garlicky Caesar dressing included.
Read More

title: MeyerLemonCookieThins
description:
An “Old World Recipe” for the new age shopper, Trader Joe’s Meyer Lemon Cookie Thins are an elegantly simple, refreshing, and flavor-filled treat. Using real Meyer lemon oils, these Cookie Thins exhibit the allure of this sought after lemon variety. Without the tang of “regular” lemons, Meyer lemons are a much more mellow sweetness that lends itself wonderfully to baking and using in sweeter applications than traditional lemon varieties.
Read More

title: PizzaSeasonedCrackers
description:
Trader Joe’s Pizza Seasoned Crackers are the mini, snackable version of pizza you didn’t know you needed!
Originating in Naples, pizza marinara is likely the oldest variety of tomato-topped pizza, and is the flavor profile we draw from for these unique Crackers. True to the source material, they’re generously seasoned with the pizza marinara trinity of tangy tomatoes, aromatic oregano, and a kick of garlic. Thin, wheat-based Crackers stand in for pizza crust to facilitate satisfying crispiness, optimal snackability, and an uncanny resemblance to the real deal.
Read More

title: GingerShrimpLoMein
description:
The classic Chinese-American restaurant menu has nearly too many hits to name. Wonton soup? An absolute winner. Chow mein? A total chart-topper. Fried rice? A certified phenom. And for the newest addition to our frozen entrée assortment, we’re drawing inspiration from one of the greatest hits of them all: lo mein. Made for us by a longtime supplier in Thailand who specializes in succulent shrimp dishes, Trader Joe’s Ginger Shrimp Lo Mein offers all the same rich aromatics, savory flavors, and tantalizingly toothsome textures that made lo mein such a legend in the first place.
Read More

title: OrganicEnergyJuiceShot
description:
We certainly don’t mean to cast any aspersions, but we’ve tried our fair share of other cold-pressed juices and juice shots out there, and, in the spirit of “if you can’t say something nice, don’t say anything at all,” well... we’ll leave it at that. When we go for a juice shot, we like a lot of flavor, a lot of freshness, and not a large price tag. That’s why we’re excited to bring Trader Joe’s Organic Energy Juice Shots to our fridge. Made with a mix of organic orange juice, mango purée, and spinach juice, as well as organic green tea extract, each Shot contains just about the same amount of caffeine as a cup of cooffee, and all for around half the price you’d pay for that same cup of coffee at your corner café.
Read More

title: SlicedBlackTruffleMontereyJackCheese
description:
Cool, mellow, and just a touch sweet, Monterey Jack is one of those cheeses that pretty much everyone can agree on—why, even its name makes it sound like a fundamentally friendly fellow. One of our favorite aspects of a good Monterey Jack is how well it serves as a canvas to other flavors—Pepper Jack being one of its most popular permutations. Which lead us to think: what other savory sensations might Monterey Jack mingle well with? That, in turn, lead to some epicurean experimentation, which happily lead to Trader Joe’s Sliced Black Truffle Monterey Jack Cheese.
Read More

title: PeanutButterPillows
description:
While we certainly love an over-the-top, complicated candy from time to time, there is something about a sublimely simple sweet that’s utterly irresistible. Take Trader Joe’s Peanut Butter Pillows, for instance. Made for us in small batches from an awesomely old-fashioned recipe, these delicately crunchy confections start with layers of crispy, flaky, lightly salted peanut butter, which our supplier then surrounds with a thin (and also rather crispy) candy layer. As you eat them, you can choose to let the layer dissolve on your tongue before biting through the crisp, sweet-savory, peanut butter center, or expedite your sweet-eating experience into one resounding, satisfying .
Read More

title: GreenTeaandYuzuSpread
description:
Originally cultivated in mainland East Asia, but now more typically associated with Japanese cuisine, specifically, a yuzu is a refreshingly aromatic citrus with a flavor somewhere between a grapefruit and a Mandarin orange. It’s often paired with sweeter, spicier, and earthier flavors, and makes a particularly great pairing with honey, chile peppers, and green tea. In fact, that last combo is what inspired our uniquely delicious, summer-seasonal, Trader Joe’s Green Tea & Yuzu Spread.
Read More

title: OrganicAppleCinnamonFruitSauceCrushers
description:
The full panoply (or should we say, panapple-y) of Trader Joe’s Organic Fruit Sauce Crushers includes Apple Strawberry, Apple Mango, Apple Banana, Apple Carrot, and of course the original, Apple. Now, our latest Crush includes a fall-famous spice that’s about as apple-friendly as one could be!
Trader Joe’s Organic Apple Cinnamon Fruit Sauce Crushers are simple in construction, and profoundly classic on the palate. It only takes three ingredients to create this taste: organic apple purée, organic cinnamon powder, and ascorbic acid (to maintain color). Unscrew the top, raise it to your mouth, and give it a gentle squeeze. You’ll experience sweet, crushed Apple, and warm, woody Cinnamon—blended into a Fruit Sauce that is ideal for an anytime snack, and enticing for people of all ages.
Read More

title: UncuredBeefHotDogs
description:
While most folks would probably peg the hamburger as the most representative American food, we'd have to  throw our support behind the humble hot dog. Aside from its close association with baseball (the American national pastime) and summertime (arguably the most American season, though that's another topic altogether), only pizza comes close to the hot dog in its proliferation of regional variation throughout these United States. Practically every major American state and city has their own specific spin on hot dogs, from the vibrantly vegetal Chicago dog, to the chili-and-onion-smothered dogs of Coney Island, to the bacon-wrapped hot dogs of Los Angeles. And so, to help celebrate the holistically American hot dog, we proudly offer Trader Joe's Uncured Beef Hot Dogs, to be enjoyed in whatever preparation you prefer-from sea to shining sea.
Read More

title: CaliforniaRoll
description:
If you are a Japanese food fan, you probably have a favorite local spot where you like to pop in and have sushi rolls. We’re glad to announce that now you can ‘pop in’ to your neighborhood TJ’s for a Trader Joe’s California Roll next time you’re craving maki.
Our California Roll is made in the traditional Japanese style, starting with white rice that’s seasoned with rice vinegar, and layered with a sheet of dried nori seaweed. Before it’s rolled, we add fresh cucumber, avocado, and imitation crab made from Alaskan pollock. It’s finished with a sprinkle of white & black sesame seeds.
Read More

title: VegetableRoll
description:
If you are a Japanese food fan, you likely have a favorite local spot where you like to pop in and have sushi rolls. We're glad to announce that you can 'pop in' to your neighborhood TJ's for a Trader Joe's Vegetable Roll next time you're craving maki. 
Our Vegetable Roll is made in the traditional Japanese style, starting with white rice that's seasoned with rice vinegar, and layered with a sheet of dried nori seaweed. Before it's rolled, we add fresh cucumber, avocado, and shredded carrots. It's finished with a sprinkle of white & black sesame seeds.
Read More

title: CrispyJalapeñoPieces
description:
During the autumn and winter months, one of our favorite ways to add a bit of savory flavor and a touch of crunchy texture to a dish is our Gourmet Fried Onion Pieces, which you might be most familiar with for their role in a classic green bean casserole. Of course, we certainly don’t stop enjoying adding savory flavor and crunchy texture to dishes during the rest of the year. That’s where Trader Joe’s Crispy Jalapeño Pieces come in. Available in our stores all year round, these captivatingly Crispy bits provide some satisfying savoriness and crunch to anything they’re added to, as well as a nice, even level of Jalapeño heat.
Read More

title: LemonFlowerCookies
description:
“The flowers that bloom in the spring, tra la! Breathe promise of merry sunshine.” —Gilbert & Sullivan
Ah, spring. That time of year when nature reawakens, spreading boundless blossoms across the landscape—it’s downright inspiring. In fact, it’s inspired us to celebrate the season the best way we know how: with jammy shortbread cookies. Trader Joe’s Lemon Flower Cookies are made for us by a trusted bakery partner, who starts with a base of beautifully buttery shortbread dough that’s been flavored with lemon oil and colored a pastel yellow with turmeric. After shaping the dough into a fancifully floral shape and baking it to a flawlessly crumbly texture, they then fill the center with a lemon jam, so that every bite sings with a satisfyingly citric sweetness.
Read More

title: GreenOliveFlatsItalianLingueCrackers
description:
So named for their resemblance to a tongue, Italian lingue (pronounced LEAN-gweh) crackers may just be the ideal edible instrument on which to serve cheese. They’re traditionally made by rolling savory-seasoned dough into a flat, roughly rectangular, tongue-like shape, then baking them until they’re superlatively crisp and snackable. For Trader Joe’s Green Olive Flats, the newest addition to our snacks section, our supplier in Italy goes the extra step of mixing bits of green olive into theirs, which provides a perfectly piquant briny flavor into every bite.
Read More

title: AngusC.B.P.GroundBeefPatties
description:
One of the great joys of the warmer months is grilling your own burgers at home. Trader Joe’s has always been an enthusiastic supporter of home-grillers, with our top-quality ground beef options, such as 85/15 Organic Grass Fed Ground Beef, and 80/20 Ground Beef Patties. For those looking for a ready- for-the-grill burger with a uniquely flavorful twist, you’ll want to try Trader Joe’s Angus C.B.P. Ground Beef 1/3 lb. Patties.
Read More

title: PeanutButterwithHoney
description:
Peanut butter is an undeniably sought after flavor in some of our customers’ favorite products (e.g., Peanut Butter Pretzels, Dark Chocolate Peanut Butter Cups, et al.). As such, our buyers have spent quite a bit of time exploring where else to employ peanut butter. But when they started pondering how we might put other things into peanut butter, we knew they’d hit a gold mine—or, rather, honey pot. Introducing Trader Joe’s Peanut Butter with Honey!
Read More

title: OrganicMangoVinaigretteDressing
description:
As it turns out, summertime salads positively shine when dressed in a fusion of sweet, tangy, and tropical flavors... And lucky for you, Trader Joe’s Organic Mango Vinaigrette Dressing deftly incorporates each of these attributes, setting the table for some fantastically fresh, summer fare.
A fairly simple blend of organic mango purée, vegetable oil, distilled white vinegar, and cane sugar (plus organic orange juice concentrate, dried red bell peppers, and garlic powder for added vim and vigor), our Organic Mango Vinaigrette lends itself to all sorts of applications. You can, of course, add a splash to salads (spinach + feta + toasted almonds + Organic Mango Vinaigrette = yum), or you can use it as a marinade for grilled chicken. Or as a fancy inclusion for fish tacos. Or as the star of a cold noodle dish or pasta salad...
Read More

title: Spinach&RicottaRaviolini
description:
Trader Joe’s Spinach & Ricotta Raviolini are tiny ravioli that are made for us in Italy by pasta pillow pros. We call them “pros” because it’s very challenging to fill and keep closed such small ravioli. After a year of research (no joke!)—and equipped with a new, specially made die to cut the pasta—our Raviolini line was up and running.
Each Raviolini is 50% pasta and 50% filling, which is a rare ratio in the stuffed-pasta universe. The pasta is formed from a delicate, egg and durum-wheat flour dough. The filling includes spinach in a creamy, garlicky bechamel sauce, with a rich blend of ricotta & mozzarella cheeses.
Read More

title: SteamedVegetableSoupDumplings
description:
From the moment they were introduced, our Steamed Chicken Soup Dumplings and Steamed Pork & Ginger Soup Dumplings became instant sensations among our customers. Inspired by the winsome dim sum tradition of Chinese xiao long bao, these aromatic and savory, soup-filled dumplings are such a darling, in fact, that we’ve received countless requests to make a vegan version, as well. After trying a few variations, our tasting panel found that a mix of jackfruit, carrot, cabbage, spinach, and ginger for the filling, along with a hearty, aromatic broth (made with vegan-friendly agar-agar, rather than gelatin) made for a truly captivating combination—and thus, Trader Joe’s Steamed Vegetable Soup Dumplings were born!
Read More

title: BubbleWaffles
description:
If you’re a fan of bubble tea beverages (a.k.a. boba), then chances are you’ve seen Bubble Waffles sold right along with them. Also known as gai daan zai in Cantonese, they first appeared on the Hong Kong street-food scene way back in the 1950s. Later nicknamed “Bubble Waffles,” at least in part for their uncanny resemblance to actual bubble wrap, they’ve been a standby in cafés, sidewalk stalls, and home kitchens ever since... and now, in the freezers at your neighborhood Trader Joe’s, too! (We can sense your bubbling joy from here!)
Read More

title: DarkChocolateCoveredPistachios
description:
For just a moment, consider the complementary nature of dark chocolate and pistachios with us, won’t you? In terms of flavor, there’s the earthy, delicately sweet notes of a finely roasted pistachio, which plays remarkably well off of the rich, ever-so-slightly bitter elements of dark chocolate. And texture-wise, the tooth-sinking smoothness of dark chocolate superbly rounds out a pistachio’s tender interior after its initial, delicately snappy bite. It’s like they were made for each other—a match made in snacking heaven, if you will. We certainly will, which is precisely why we’ve introduced Trader Joe’s Dark Chocolate Covered Pistachios to our shelves.
Read More

title: CottonPicnicCloths
description:
Ah, for the simple pleasures of a summertime picinic. There’s just something about the act of eating outside, amongst nature and friends and family, that makes one feel a little more at peace with the world. Of course, we certainly feel even more at peace with the world when we’ve got a nice napkin to go along with all that (potentially messy) nature and food and fellowship—and that’s precisely why we’re introducing Trader Joe’s Cotton Picnic Cloths to our shelves for the summer season.
Read More

title: CheddarMacaroni&Cheese
description:
Our boxed Mac & Cheese is back! While we have numerous heat & eat, cheesy-mac options in our freezers every day, there’s something about boiling fresh pasta and stirring it together with butter, milk, and cheese that really stirs up one’s nostalgia. Trader Joe’s Cheddar Macaroni & Cheese rises to meet all of your childhood memories and more!
Each box contains little tube-shaped Macaroni that you boil in a saucepan to your desired tenderness. We recommend 7-9 minutes. To the drained pasta, add 4 tablespoons of butter (we suggest salted), ¼ cup of milk, and the included cheese packet. The Cheddar Cheese seasoning blend creates a creamy, ultra-cheesy sauce to coat the tubes inside and out. And that classic orange color only comes naturally, from annatto and paprika.
Read More

title: TropicalGreenTeaInstantBobaKit
description:
Two summers back, we brought the proverbial boba shop home with the introduction of our everyday Instant Boba Kit [sku 73998], and it’s remained a hot ticket in our freezers ever since. So much so, in fact, that when approached by a Taiwanese supplier with an opportunity to offer a limited-time, more Tropical-tasting Boba Kit, we lept at the chance! You’ll be leaping, too, as soon as you get your hands on a Trader Joe’s Tropical Green Tea Instant Boba Kit.
Read More

title: PanzerottiPizzaBites
description:
What look like mini calzones, taste like cheese pizza, and eat like some of the tastiest hors d’oeuvres around? New Trader Joe’s Panzerotti Pizza Bites, that’s what! Made for us in Southern Italy by a supplier who specializes in this very appetizer, these two-to-three-bite-sized, lightly fried Pizza pockets take the concept of “after-school pizza rolls” and elevates it to flavorful new heights!
Read More

title: PadSeeEw
description:
An indisputable icon of Thai restaurant menus and street food stalls the world over, pad see ew translates to “fried with soy sauce,” and was likely popularized within Thailand by Chinese immigrants in the early 20th century. A bit like a localized, Thai-cuisine-informed variation of chow fun (which was likely a direct inspiration), pad see ew is traditionally made with wide, flat rice noodles, which are fried in a wok with various veggies and garlic before being finished with a splash of light and dark soy sauce to give it a bold, savory, and umami-rich flavor. And that’s the same, time-tested technique that our supplier in Thailand uses when making Trader Joe’s Pad See Ew, a rich, flavorful, and totally vegan version of this classic dish that’s now available in our freezers.
Read More

title: PulledChickenSalsaVerde
description:
In addition to developing foods with high-quality ingredients that are combined using exceptional recipes, we are also keen to develop Trader Joe’s products that are convenient, time-saving meal solutions for our customers. Trader Joe’s Pulled Chicken Salsa Verde is one of those products that checks all the boxes!
Similar to Trader Joe’s Smoked Pulled Chicken, this Pulled Chicken recipe begins with seasoned, boneless, skinless Chicken breast. But here, the meat isn’t smoked. It’s seasoned with salt, white pepper, and garlic & onion powders, then slow-cooked in a Salsa Verde that includes roasted tomatillos, green chiles, cilantro, onion and garlic. The fully cooked meat is then shredded, so its really easy to tuck into tacos, burritos, quesadillas, or to pile on top of chips for nachos. And it’ll save you time on a busy weeknight, since all it takes to prepare is about four minutes in the microwave. Add a couple more minutes to that if you’d prefer to heat it in a saucepan on the stovetop. Either way, you’ll have a terrifically tender & flavorful protein you can use in a wide variety of simple, satisfying ways.
Read More

title: Bacon&EggsShapedSweetGummyCandies
description:
If you thought breakfast for dinner was fun, wait until you try breakfast for dessert—talk about a walk on the wild side! That’s exactly what you’ll get with new, get-’em-while-we’ve-got-’em, available-for-a-limited-time- only Trader Joe’s Bacon & Eggs Shaped Sweet Gummy Candies.
Our Bacon & Eggs Shaped Gummy Candies might look like small, sunny-side up eggs and little pieces of pink-ish bacon, but that’s about where the similarities end—because this batch of Bacon & Eggs is soft, chewy, and decidedly , not savory. The “Bacon” pieces are cherry-flavored, the “Eggs” taste a bit like mango, and, unlike a real bacon & egg breakfast, there’s no pork involved—these Bacon & Eggs Shaped Gummy Candies are gelatin-free! How’s that for a sweet ‘n sizzling power couple?
Read More

title: YuzuMisoTopping&Spread
description:

That certain something that will make the cheeses cheesier, the dips more dippable, and the spreads more spreadable. It’s the crackers. Face it: without the right crackers, all will be lost. And “all will be lost” does not make for a happy happening. Every party is saved with the addition of Trader Joe’s Cracker Assortment.

title: GingerShrimpLoMein
description:
The classic Chinese-American restaurant menu has nearly too many hits to name. Wonton soup? An absolute winner. Chow mein? A total chart-topper. Fried rice? A certified phenom. And for the newest addition to our frozen entrée assortment, we’re drawing inspiration from one of the greatest hits of them all: lo mein. Made for us by a longtime supplier in Thailand who specializes in succulent shrimp dishes, Trader Joe’s Ginger Shrimp Lo Mein offers all the same rich aromatics, savory flavors, and tantalizingly toothsome textures that made lo mein such a legend in the first place.
Read More

title: SmokedGhostPepperCheddarCheese
description:
Things are heating up in the Trader Joe’s cheese section this summer! Made for us by a renowned Wisconsin creamery that’s known for their sharp, rich Cheddars, a trio of hot chili peppers is mixed into every batch of Trader Joe’s Smoked Ghost Pepper Cheddar Cheese before the whole wheel is smoked over aromatic hickory. Together, the capsaicin-laden combo of jalapeño, habanero, and fiery hot Ghost Pepper, along with its subtly smoky tones give this newest addition to our Spotlight Cheese program a uniquely savory and delightfully (though not overwhelmingly) spicy flavor profile.
Read More

title: PeachRaspberryCrisp
description:
Nothing quite captures the essence of summer like seasonal fruit, and a little extra sweetness and crunch takes things to an entirely new level. Enter: Trader Joe’s Peach Raspberry Crisp, a delightfully sweet, tart, and buttery pastry that tastes just like summer.
Dating back to at least the 1920s, crisps forego pastry crust in favor of a, well, crispy oat crumble baked over a fruity filling. Our Peach Raspberry Crisp takes a summery spin on the classic pastry with ripe, sweetened peaches and raspberries baked underneath a crunchy, all-butter streusel.
Read More

title: ChocolateBrooklynBabka
description:
Chocolate Brooklyn Babka is a sweet, swirly brioche-meets-cake loaf rooted in Eastern European Jewish traditions. In both Polish and Yiddish, “babka” is the diminutive of “baba,” meaning “grandmother.” And the character of this sweet, fluffy, chocolate-laden cake lives up to its namesake—welcoming you with open arms and old-world charm, just as your baba would.
Read More

title: RoastedCorn
description:
Trader Joe’s Roasted Corn is grown in the sunny valleys of Washington State and harvested at the peak of ripeness. It’s then roasted over an open flame, adding a smoky dimension to the corn’s natural sweetness. After roasting, the corn is individually quick frozen to ensure freshness and allow you to use what you like now and save the rest for another time.
If you’re looking for a versatile side dish, our Roasted Corn may just fit the bill. The corn is great by itself and fits great with a variety of other combinations, especially in ethnic dishes. Once cooked, toss the amount of Corn you would like to use for a Mexican-style salad with Organic Black Beans, quinoa, cilantro, topped with sweet peppers, onions, avocado and creamy, Cilantro Dressing with crumbled cotija cheese. The Corn makes for a delicious Elote in a cup, also known as Esquites. Just like you would on a corn on the cob, add Real Mayonnaise, grated Cotija Cheese, chili powder, and a Trader Joe’s touch with our crushed Elote Chips. You’ll find each 16-ounce bag of Trader Joe’s Roasted Corn in our freezers.
Read More

title: CarbSavvyTortillasmadewithWholeWheat
description:
If you are not that carb savvy, you might think 9g of carbohydrates in one serving of Trader Joe’s Carb Savvy Tortillas is not that impressive. In fact, for someone watching their carbs, it’s excellent!
Carb Savvy Tortillas contain less overall carbs than regular tortillas, and the carbs they do contain are mostly from dietary fiber. Accordingly, these reduced-carb tortillas are an excellent source of dietary fiber, providing 6g per tortilla. That’s 21% of your daily recommended value of fiber!
Read More

title: SlicedBlackTruffleMontereyJackCheese
description:
Cool, mellow, and just a touch sweet, Monterey Jack is one of those cheeses that pretty much everyone can agree on—why, even its name makes it sound like a fundamentally friendly fellow. One of our favorite aspects of a good Monterey Jack is how well it serves as a canvas to other flavors—Pepper Jack being one of its most popular permutations. Which lead us to think: what other savory sensations might Monterey Jack mingle well with? That, in turn, lead to some epicurean experimentation, which happily lead to Trader Joe’s Sliced Black Truffle Monterey Jack Cheese.
Read More

title: PeanutButterPillows
description:
While we certainly love an over-the-top, complicated candy from time to time, there is something about a sublimely simple sweet that’s utterly irresistible. Take Trader Joe’s Peanut Butter Pillows, for instance. Made for us in small batches from an awesomely old-fashioned recipe, these delicately crunchy confections start with layers of crispy, flaky, lightly salted peanut butter, which our supplier then surrounds with a thin (and also rather crispy) candy layer. As you eat them, you can choose to let the layer dissolve on your tongue before biting through the crisp, sweet-savory, peanut butter center, or expedite your sweet-eating experience into one resounding, satisfying .
Read More

title: GreenTeaandYuzuSpread
description:
Originally cultivated in mainland East Asia, but now more typically associated with Japanese cuisine, specifically, a yuzu is a refreshingly aromatic citrus with a flavor somewhere between a grapefruit and a Mandarin orange. It’s often paired with sweeter, spicier, and earthier flavors, and makes a particularly great pairing with honey, chile peppers, and green tea. In fact, that last combo is what inspired our uniquely delicious, summer-seasonal, Trader Joe’s Green Tea & Yuzu Spread.
Read More

title: OrganicAppleCinnamonFruitSauceCrushers
description:
The full panoply (or should we say, panapple-y) of Trader Joe’s Organic Fruit Sauce Crushers includes Apple Strawberry, Apple Mango, Apple Banana, Apple Carrot, and of course the original, Apple. Now, our latest Crush includes a fall-famous spice that’s about as apple-friendly as one could be!
Trader Joe’s Organic Apple Cinnamon Fruit Sauce Crushers are simple in construction, and profoundly classic on the palate. It only takes three ingredients to create this taste: organic apple purée, organic cinnamon powder, and ascorbic acid (to maintain color). Unscrew the top, raise it to your mouth, and give it a gentle squeeze. You’ll experience sweet, crushed Apple, and warm, woody Cinnamon—blended into a Fruit Sauce that is ideal for an anytime snack, and enticing for people of all ages.
Read More

title: UncuredBeefHotDogs
description:
While most folks would probably peg the hamburger as the most representative American food, we'd have to  throw our support behind the humble hot dog. Aside from its close association with baseball (the American national pastime) and summertime (arguably the most American season, though that's another topic altogether), only pizza comes close to the hot dog in its proliferation of regional variation throughout these United States. Practically every major American state and city has their own specific spin on hot dogs, from the vibrantly vegetal Chicago dog, to the chili-and-onion-smothered dogs of Coney Island, to the bacon-wrapped hot dogs of Los Angeles. And so, to help celebrate the holistically American hot dog, we proudly offer Trader Joe's Uncured Beef Hot Dogs, to be enjoyed in whatever preparation you prefer-from sea to shining sea.
Read More

title: CaliforniaRoll
description:
If you are a Japanese food fan, you probably have a favorite local spot where you like to pop in and have sushi rolls. We’re glad to announce that now you can ‘pop in’ to your neighborhood TJ’s for a Trader Joe’s California Roll next time you’re craving maki.
Our California Roll is made in the traditional Japanese style, starting with white rice that’s seasoned with rice vinegar, and layered with a sheet of dried nori seaweed. Before it’s rolled, we add fresh cucumber, avocado, and imitation crab made from Alaskan pollock. It’s finished with a sprinkle of white & black sesame seeds.
Read More

title: VegetableRoll
description:
If you are a Japanese food fan, you likely have a favorite local spot where you like to pop in and have sushi rolls. We're glad to announce that you can 'pop in' to your neighborhood TJ's for a Trader Joe's Vegetable Roll next time you're craving maki. 
Our Vegetable Roll is made in the traditional Japanese style, starting with white rice that's seasoned with rice vinegar, and layered with a sheet of dried nori seaweed. Before it's rolled, we add fresh cucumber, avocado, and shredded carrots. It's finished with a sprinkle of white & black sesame seeds.
Read More

title: CrispyJalapeñoPieces
description:
During the autumn and winter months, one of our favorite ways to add a bit of savory flavor and a touch of crunchy texture to a dish is our Gourmet Fried Onion Pieces, which you might be most familiar with for their role in a classic green bean casserole. Of course, we certainly don’t stop enjoying adding savory flavor and crunchy texture to dishes during the rest of the year. That’s where Trader Joe’s Crispy Jalapeño Pieces come in. Available in our stores all year round, these captivatingly Crispy bits provide some satisfying savoriness and crunch to anything they’re added to, as well as a nice, even level of Jalapeño heat.
Read More

title: OrganicBeets
description:
We have a contingent of beet fans who’ve celebrated our Steamed and Peeled Baby Beets since the moment they were first introduced. However, there’s a certain type of beet fan—a hardcore beet enthusiast, one might say—who still wants more. For those who revel in the pleasure and versatility of raw, round, red roots, we’ve got good news: Trader Joe’s Organic Beets have arrived!
Read More

title: ShreddedOrganicMozzarellaCheese
description:
We have no guilt in admitting a freshly opened bag of Trader Joe’s Organic Shredded Mozzarella Cheese is a tempting shortcut to eschew any skinned knuckles and wasted time grating your own mozzarella. While taking the time to make it yourself has its place, we really try our best to deliver you the freshest, softest, and stretchiest Organic Shredded Mozzarella Cheese we can find!
Read More

title: LemonFlowerCookies
description:
“The flowers that bloom in the spring, tra la! Breathe promise of merry sunshine.” —Gilbert & Sullivan
Ah, spring. That time of year when nature reawakens, spreading boundless blossoms across the landscape—it’s downright inspiring. In fact, it’s inspired us to celebrate the season the best way we know how: with jammy shortbread cookies. Trader Joe’s Lemon Flower Cookies are made for us by a trusted bakery partner, who starts with a base of beautifully buttery shortbread dough that’s been flavored with lemon oil and colored a pastel yellow with turmeric. After shaping the dough into a fancifully floral shape and baking it to a flawlessly crumbly texture, they then fill the center with a lemon jam, so that every bite sings with a satisfyingly citric sweetness.
Read More

title: GreenOliveFlatsItalianLingueCrackers
description:
So named for their resemblance to a tongue, Italian lingue (pronounced LEAN-gweh) crackers may just be the ideal edible instrument on which to serve cheese. They’re traditionally made by rolling savory-seasoned dough into a flat, roughly rectangular, tongue-like shape, then baking them until they’re superlatively crisp and snackable. For Trader Joe’s Green Olive Flats, the newest addition to our snacks section, our supplier in Italy goes the extra step of mixing bits of green olive into theirs, which provides a perfectly piquant briny flavor into every bite.
Read More

title: AngusC.B.P.GroundBeefPatties
description:
One of the great joys of the warmer months is grilling your own burgers at home. Trader Joe’s has always been an enthusiastic supporter of home-grillers, with our top-quality ground beef options, such as 85/15 Organic Grass Fed Ground Beef, and 80/20 Ground Beef Patties. For those looking for a ready- for-the-grill burger with a uniquely flavorful twist, you’ll want to try Trader Joe’s Angus C.B.P. Ground Beef 1/3 lb. Patties.
Read More

title: PeanutButterwithHoney
description:
Peanut butter is an undeniably sought after flavor in some of our customers’ favorite products (e.g., Peanut Butter Pretzels, Dark Chocolate Peanut Butter Cups, et al.). As such, our buyers have spent quite a bit of time exploring where else to employ peanut butter. But when they started pondering how we might put other things into peanut butter, we knew they’d hit a gold mine—or, rather, honey pot. Introducing Trader Joe’s Peanut Butter with Honey!
Read More

title: OrganicMangoVinaigretteDressing
description:
As it turns out, summertime salads positively shine when dressed in a fusion of sweet, tangy, and tropical flavors... And lucky for you, Trader Joe’s Organic Mango Vinaigrette Dressing deftly incorporates each of these attributes, setting the table for some fantastically fresh, summer fare.
A fairly simple blend of organic mango purée, vegetable oil, distilled white vinegar, and cane sugar (plus organic orange juice concentrate, dried red bell peppers, and garlic powder for added vim and vigor), our Organic Mango Vinaigrette lends itself to all sorts of applications. You can, of course, add a splash to salads (spinach + feta + toasted almonds + Organic Mango Vinaigrette = yum), or you can use it as a marinade for grilled chicken. Or as a fancy inclusion for fish tacos. Or as the star of a cold noodle dish or pasta salad...
Read More

title: Spinach&RicottaRaviolini
description:
Trader Joe’s Spinach & Ricotta Raviolini are tiny ravioli that are made for us in Italy by pasta pillow pros. We call them “pros” because it’s very challenging to fill and keep closed such small ravioli. After a year of research (no joke!)—and equipped with a new, specially made die to cut the pasta—our Raviolini line was up and running.
Each Raviolini is 50% pasta and 50% filling, which is a rare ratio in the stuffed-pasta universe. The pasta is formed from a delicate, egg and durum-wheat flour dough. The filling includes spinach in a creamy, garlicky bechamel sauce, with a rich blend of ricotta & mozzarella cheeses.
Read More

title: SteamedVegetableSoupDumplings
description:
From the moment they were introduced, our Steamed Chicken Soup Dumplings and Steamed Pork & Ginger Soup Dumplings became instant sensations among our customers. Inspired by the winsome dim sum tradition of Chinese xiao long bao, these aromatic and savory, soup-filled dumplings are such a darling, in fact, that we’ve received countless requests to make a vegan version, as well. After trying a few variations, our tasting panel found that a mix of jackfruit, carrot, cabbage, spinach, and ginger for the filling, along with a hearty, aromatic broth (made with vegan-friendly agar-agar, rather than gelatin) made for a truly captivating combination—and thus, Trader Joe’s Steamed Vegetable Soup Dumplings were born!
Read More

title: BubbleWaffles
description:
If you’re a fan of bubble tea beverages (a.k.a. boba), then chances are you’ve seen Bubble Waffles sold right along with them. Also known as gai daan zai in Cantonese, they first appeared on the Hong Kong street-food scene way back in the 1950s. Later nicknamed “Bubble Waffles,” at least in part for their uncanny resemblance to actual bubble wrap, they’ve been a standby in cafés, sidewalk stalls, and home kitchens ever since... and now, in the freezers at your neighborhood Trader Joe’s, too! (We can sense your bubbling joy from here!)
Read More

title: DarkChocolateCoveredPistachios
description:
For just a moment, consider the complementary nature of dark chocolate and pistachios with us, won’t you? In terms of flavor, there’s the earthy, delicately sweet notes of a finely roasted pistachio, which plays remarkably well off of the rich, ever-so-slightly bitter elements of dark chocolate. And texture-wise, the tooth-sinking smoothness of dark chocolate superbly rounds out a pistachio’s tender interior after its initial, delicately snappy bite. It’s like they were made for each other—a match made in snacking heaven, if you will. We certainly will, which is precisely why we’ve introduced Trader Joe’s Dark Chocolate Covered Pistachios to our shelves.
Read More

title: CheddarMacaroni&Cheese
description:
Our boxed Mac & Cheese is back! While we have numerous heat & eat, cheesy-mac options in our freezers every day, there’s something about boiling fresh pasta and stirring it together with butter, milk, and cheese that really stirs up one’s nostalgia. Trader Joe’s Cheddar Macaroni & Cheese rises to meet all of your childhood memories and more!
Each box contains little tube-shaped Macaroni that you boil in a saucepan to your desired tenderness. We recommend 7-9 minutes. To the drained pasta, add 4 tablespoons of butter (we suggest salted), ¼ cup of milk, and the included cheese packet. The Cheddar Cheese seasoning blend creates a creamy, ultra-cheesy sauce to coat the tubes inside and out. And that classic orange color only comes naturally, from annatto and paprika.
Read More

title: TropicalGreenTeaInstantBobaKit
description:
Two summers back, we brought the proverbial boba shop home with the introduction of our everyday Instant Boba Kit [sku 73998], and it’s remained a hot ticket in our freezers ever since. So much so, in fact, that when approached by a Taiwanese supplier with an opportunity to offer a limited-time, more Tropical-tasting Boba Kit, we lept at the chance! You’ll be leaping, too, as soon as you get your hands on a Trader Joe’s Tropical Green Tea Instant Boba Kit.
Read More

title: PanzerottiPizzaBites
description:
What look like mini calzones, taste like cheese pizza, and eat like some of the tastiest hors d’oeuvres around? New Trader Joe’s Panzerotti Pizza Bites, that’s what! Made for us in Southern Italy by a supplier who specializes in this very appetizer, these two-to-three-bite-sized, lightly fried Pizza pockets take the concept of “after-school pizza rolls” and elevates it to flavorful new heights!
Read More

title: PadSeeEw
description:
An indisputable icon of Thai restaurant menus and street food stalls the world over, pad see ew translates to “fried with soy sauce,” and was likely popularized within Thailand by Chinese immigrants in the early 20th century. A bit like a localized, Thai-cuisine-informed variation of chow fun (which was likely a direct inspiration), pad see ew is traditionally made with wide, flat rice noodles, which are fried in a wok with various veggies and garlic before being finished with a splash of light and dark soy sauce to give it a bold, savory, and umami-rich flavor. And that’s the same, time-tested technique that our supplier in Thailand uses when making Trader Joe’s Pad See Ew, a rich, flavorful, and totally vegan version of this classic dish that’s now available in our freezers.
Read More

title: PulledChickenSalsaVerde
description:
In addition to developing foods with high-quality ingredients that are combined using exceptional recipes, we are also keen to develop Trader Joe’s products that are convenient, time-saving meal solutions for our customers. Trader Joe’s Pulled Chicken Salsa Verde is one of those products that checks all the boxes!
Similar to Trader Joe’s Smoked Pulled Chicken, this Pulled Chicken recipe begins with seasoned, boneless, skinless Chicken breast. But here, the meat isn’t smoked. It’s seasoned with salt, white pepper, and garlic & onion powders, then slow-cooked in a Salsa Verde that includes roasted tomatillos, green chiles, cilantro, onion and garlic. The fully cooked meat is then shredded, so its really easy to tuck into tacos, burritos, quesadillas, or to pile on top of chips for nachos. And it’ll save you time on a busy weeknight, since all it takes to prepare is about four minutes in the microwave. Add a couple more minutes to that if you’d prefer to heat it in a saucepan on the stovetop. Either way, you’ll have a terrifically tender & flavorful protein you can use in a wide variety of simple, satisfying ways.
Read More

title: Bacon&EggsShapedSweetGummyCandies
description:
If you thought breakfast for dinner was fun, wait until you try breakfast for dessert—talk about a walk on the wild side! That’s exactly what you’ll get with new, get-’em-while-we’ve-got-’em, available-for-a-limited-time- only Trader Joe’s Bacon & Eggs Shaped Sweet Gummy Candies.
Our Bacon & Eggs Shaped Gummy Candies might look like small, sunny-side up eggs and little pieces of pink-ish bacon, but that’s about where the similarities end—because this batch of Bacon & Eggs is soft, chewy, and decidedly , not savory. The “Bacon” pieces are cherry-flavored, the “Eggs” taste a bit like mango, and, unlike a real bacon & egg breakfast, there’s no pork involved—these Bacon & Eggs Shaped Gummy Candies are gelatin-free! How’s that for a sweet ‘n sizzling power couple?
Read More

title: FreshMozzarellaCheeseSnackers
description:
Maybe you enjoy Trader Joe’s String Cheese, or our Organic Light String Cheese. These individual sticks of milky mozzarella are a great option when you want a little protein boost, or are craving a bit of cheese. Now we’ve added another option to our family of handy cheese snacks: Trader Joe’s Fresh Mozzarella Cheese Snackers.
These bite-size balls of fresh mozzarella are made from milk that’s freshly collected in the Treasure and Magic Valleys of southern Idaho; and it comes from cows that are not treated with rBST hormones. Making the Mozzarella involves microbial enzymes, which should please any cheese-loving vegetarians. The soft, yet reslient texture of the final product—with its creamy, milky flavor—should please anyone who loves good cheese!
Read More

title: DoubleChocolateWaferCookies
description:
Wafer cookie enthusiasts might recall that, for years, we sold a certain branded chocolate wafer cookie in our stores. They were certainly delicious, but at Trader Joe’s, we’re all about kaizen—and we knew there was room for improvement. Now, many months and several versions later, we’re excited to introduce the chocolatey manifestation of our sweetest efforts: Trader Joe’s Double Chocolate Wafer Cookies.
Read More

title: MangoCreamBars
description: Creamy, fruity, frozen bars are so fun and yummy for summer. Flavor-wise, these are a combination of creamy vanilla and sweet-tart mango. They're rich and creamy because the first ingredient is vanilla ice cream! And the fruity part is made with purée of both Magdalena and Alphonso mango varieties, delivering a tart & sweet, totally tropical taste!

title: Rainbow'sEndTrailMixBars
description:
When we first introduced Trader Joe’s Rainbow’s End Trail Mix [sku 36825] to our shelves back in 2000, it truly set the bar for how sublimely simple a trail mix could be. With just a minimalist mix of peanuts, almonds, raisins, and candy-coated milk chocolate gems, every bite contains a remarkable medley of flavors and textures, which is why it’s remained a solid gold hit with our customers for nearly 25 years. So how does one celebrate such a bar-setting snack? How about by recontextualizing it into a new setting: a highly snackable Bar? 
Read More

title: CaramelizedOnion&BellPepperTurkeyPatties
description:
When you read the words “juicy burger,” turkey is not likely the first meat that comes to mind—but what if it was? Our product developer set out to answer this very question while working to create summertime stars for grilling season (May to September, to be precise), and much to our tasting panel’s delight, he emerged victorious from the test kitchen with Trader Joe’s Caramelized Onion & Bell Pepper Turkey Patties.
Read More

title: NorwegianSourdoughRyeChips
description:
In Scandinavia, rye has been a staple since at least the Middle Ages. But why rye? The key to rye’s rise lies in this grassy crop’s ability to flourish in a colder climate. It also had to do with rye’s dense, earthy, and pleasantly sour character when milled and used in baked goods. Trader Joe’s Norwegian Sourdough Rye Chips capitalize on rye’s goodness by delivering this dark, delicious grain in a crisp, seedy cracker.
 
A bakery in Norway makes our Sourdough Rye Chips. First, they bake bread from a wheat and rye sourdough that includes whole-grain rye berries, sunflower seeds, and flax seeds. The bread is thinly sliced, fried in sunflower oil, and finished with a touch of salt. Each curved, irregularly shaped Chip has a super crunch that leads to nutty notes and rich rye flavor.
 
We enjoy Trader Joe’s Norwegian Sourdough Rye Chips as a snack right out of the bag, but you can also use them to add crunch to your salad. And they’re strong enough for dipping into something savory, such as Chunky Artichoke Jalapeño Dip. For a more substantial snack, pair them with Oak Smoked Salmon Pieces and thin slices of Denmark Havarti.
Read More

title: LittleLeafFarmsBabyCrispyGreenLeaf
description:
Since their founding in 2015, the folks at Little Leaf Farms® have been dedicated to the ideal of local, sustainable, and—most of all—delicious produce. From their greenhouse facilities in Massachusetts and Pennsylvania, they use recycled, UV-sanitized rainwater to cut their groundwater use by 90%, and recycled PET plastic for their packaging. They also proudly employ pesticide-free, herbicide-free, and even hands-free growing practices, so that when you open up a package of their Baby Crispy Green Leaf Lettuce, it’s totally ready to eat—no washing required.
Read More

title: OvenDriedRed&YellowBellPepperCrisps
description:
Peter Piper was probably pleased when he picked a peck of pickled peppers. While we’d never throw shade at a nightshade in any form, we’d like to posit that peckish Peter Piper would have been even more pleased had he picked up a peck—er, a bag—of Trader Oven Dried Red & Yellow Bell Pepper Crisps instead! 
Made for us in Turkey with three simple ingredients—red bell peppers, yellow bell peppers, and sea salt—our Oven Dried Bell Pepper Crisps are an ideal anecdote to a sudden craving for some savory crunch, sans additives. Our supplier takes a 50/50 blend of fresh (not frozen) Bell Pepper slices, sprinkles them with sea salt, then dries (not fries) them in not one, but separate ovens. (Perhaps we should have gone with Oven Dried?) The first pass through the oven prepares the peppers by slowly reducing their moisture levels, and the second dries them to peak crispiness. Snacks don’t get anymore straightforward than this...
Read More

title: AvocadoOil
description:
It should come as no surprise that, here at Trader Joe’s, we’re avid advocates of avocado. And that’s true in all of avocados’ formidable forms, whether it’s mashed up in a flavorful guacamole, sliced up and adding crucial texture to a sandwich, or pressed into a lush, velvety Avocado Oil.
Indeed, Trader Joe’s Avocado Oil carries the flavor and character of avocado. It’s a luxuriously smooth, velvety Oil is made from avocados grown Mexico, which offers an ideal avo-growing climate. This delicate, buttery oil is naturally high in monounsaturated fats (10 grams per serving), and with a roughly 500oF smoke point, it makes an excellent cooking oil. (For reference, olive oil has a smoke point closer to 350oF). Its clean, delicate flavor is a great match for all kinds of applications, from sautéing to baking to searing to garnishing.
Read More

title: StringCheese
description:
It’s no secret that kids love Trader Joe’s String Cheese. It may surprise you that adults are as smitten with this stringable snack as their progeny. Once you know Trader Joe’s String Cheese comes to us from a fourth generation, family-owned, Wisconsin cheese company, the love really starts to come into focus. And when you discover that the entire cheese making process – from fresh-from-the-farm milk (from cows raised without the use of rBST) to packed-and-ready-to-ship cheese – takes only about three hours, you will be so filled with love that you’re sure to find yourself with a craving for this mild, mozzarella-style cheese that’s portable and pulls apart with such ease.
Read More

title: OrganicChocolateChipBakedWholeGrainBar
description:
Take a moment to consider the cereal bar with us, won’t you? Dependably delicious, and always there for you when you need a little pick-me-up, a good cereal bar can make the difference between a clear mind and a haze of hangriness. That’s one reason why we’re proud to add Trader Joe’s Organic Chocolate Chip Baked Whole Grain Bars to our already-estimable selection of cereal bars. Another reason? Each Bar combines the power of hearty oats, sweet fig paste, and rich chocolate chips to create a superlatively satisfying snacking experience.
Read More

title: OrganicIcedOatmealBakedWholeGrainBar
description:
Take a moment to consider the cereal bar with us, won’t you? Dependably delicious, and always there for you when you need a little pick-me-up, a good cereal bar can make the difference between a clear mind and a haze of hangriness. That’s one reason why we’re proud to add Trader Joe’s Organic Iced Oatmeal Baked Whole Grain Bars to our already-estimable selection of cereal bars. Another reason? Each Bar combines the power of hearty oats, sweet fig paste, and aromatic baking spice to create a superlatively satisfying snacking experience.
Read More

title: MiniShrimpBao
description:
Of all the various carbs and starches that the world’s cuisines have produced, we have to admit that we have a true soft spot for the bao bun—and for its soft and pillowy texture, in particular. That, combined with its mild, delicately savory, and just a touch sweet flavor, makes the bao bun an especially compelling conveyance for hearty proteins and aromatic sauces, as Trader Joe’s Mini Shrimp Bao rather deliciously demonstrate. Made for us by an expert supplier in Vietnam, each box contains eight miniature, clamshell-style Bao laden with a well-seasoned shrimp patty, as well as a sweet and sticky lemongrass, lime, and chili sauce for dipping.
Read More

title: SeafoodBoil
description:
In our estimation, nothing represents the very best aspects of Cajun cuisine better than a classic, Louisiana- style seafood boil. There’s the remarkable range of flavors, the ingenuity of ingredients, and, of course, the overall emphasis on community—what else can bring people together like a big batch of fiery-hot shellfish, after all? In honor of this storied (not to mention well-spiced) tradition, we’re bringing in Trader Joe’s Seafood Boil to our freezers. Each box contains a bag of shrimp, tilapia, clams, and andouille sausage, along with hearty corn on the cob and miniature potatoes, all pre-seasoned with a lip-smackingly spicy garlic butter sauce.
Read More

title: KeyLimeTeaCookies
description:
As spring makes way for summer, Trader Joe’s Key Lime Tea Cookies make their way to our cookie shelves once more. These bite-sized delights measure just over an inch in diameter, so there is only room for the essentials: powdered sugar, flour, butter, key lime powder (made from dehydrated lime juice), and natural key lime flavor—nothing extra (read: no artificial flavors here!). It’s like you baked them at home, except… you did not bake them at home, so you and your kitchen can remain cool on hot summer days.
Read More

title: CiabattaBaguette
description:
Ciabatta and baguette? Before now, you might have thought that ciabatta is ciabatta and a baguette is a baguette. But why can’t we have the best of both worlds? What if ciabatta was a baguette? And this baguette had all the enchanting qualities of ciabatta? Cue Trader Joe’s Ciabatta Baguette, the best of both bread worlds.
The loaf is in the shape of a baguette (meaning “wand” in Italian), but the bread itself is ciabatta bread. Ciabatta dough contains a higher moisture content than traditional baguette dough—over 70% in this case—giving it a thin, slightly caramelized crust and a light crumb with large holes. Better yet, it’s made with just a few in- gredients: unbleached wheat flour, water, sea salt, yeast, and malted barley. Though our supplier makes large quantities of bread, they are still able to achieve the sought-after artisanal taste and texture. And, really, what’s more artisan than the uniting of two esteemed artisan breads?
Read More

title: CiabattaDemi-Baguette
description:
Ciabatta and baguette? Before now, you might have thought that ciabatta is ciabatta and a baguette is a baguette. But why can’t we have the best of both worlds? What if ciabatta was a baguette? And this baguette had all the enchanting qualities of ciabatta? Cue Trader Joe’s Ciabatta Demi-Baguette, the best of both bread worlds.
The loaf is in the shape of a half baguette (“demi-” and “wand” in Italian), but the bread itself is ciabatta bread. Ciabatta dough contains a higher moisture content than traditional baguette dough—over 70% in this case— giving it a thin, slightly caramelized crust and a light crumb with large holes. Better yet, it’s made with just a few ingredients: unbleached wheat flour, water, sea salt, yeast, and malted barley. Though our supplier makes large quantities of bread, they are still able to achieve the sought-after artisanal taste and texture. And, really, what’s more artisan than the uniting of two esteemed artisan breads?
Read More

title: GrecianStyleEggplantwithTomatoes&Onions
description:
Trader Joe's Grecian Style Eggplant with Tomatoes & Onions is an unexpected delicacy. Upon tasting it, we were enchanted by the soft, melt-in-your-mouth texture and the smooth, almost squash-like eggplant flavor that came to life amidst the bright, savory-sweetness of the tomatoes and onions. Our tasting panel was taken by surprise—these wondrous, not-at-all-bitter eggplants really came from a can? Really? Really.
Read More

title: YuzuKosho
description:
The trick behind many great hot sauces and spicy condiments is a balance between tartness and heat—in a classic Buffalo sauce, for example, this is most often achieved via a carefully calibrated ratio of vinegar to cayenne. However, in the case of yuzu kosho, a chili paste popular in Japanese cuisine, it’s less of a balancing act and more of a gleeful deep dive into both ends of the spectrum. Made with a captivating combination of chili peppers, sea salt, and peel of yuzu (a citrus that’s downright essential in Japanese cuisine), Trader Joe’s Yuzu Kosho offers thrilling heat, invigorating zestiness, and even a touch of umami in every bracing bite.
Read More

title: LemonGingerCheesecake
description:
Just between us, dear reader: you work hard. You do! You clearly care about the kind of food you eat and feed to your loved ones, otherwise you wouldn’t be reading this page. If you don’t mind us saying so, you deserve something sweet and delicious. Honestly, you deserve to treat yourself to a Trader Joe’s Lemon Ginger Cheesecake. With everything you do, you should absolutely take the time to savor every bite of this Cheesecake’s tantalizingly tart cream cheese base, flavored with lemon curd and actual bits of lemon peel, as well as its dense, crumbly, gingersnap crust.
Read More

title: StrawberryYogurtFlavoredCoatedAlmonds
description:
The flavor of strawberries is among the most beloved tastes of early summer. Being stalwart strawberry supporters ourselves, we’re bursting with strawberry-inspired selections in our stores right now, like TJ’s Organic Strawberry Lemonade, TJ’s Strawberry Overnight Oats, TJ’s Strawberries & Crème Pancake & Waffle Mix... and now, Trader Joe’s Strawberry Yogurt Almonds, too!
Read More

title: SuperStrawberrySorbet
description:
We didn’t just name our brand-new sorbet flavor “Super Strawberry Sorbet,” for the alliteration. (Although, it is fun to say.) In fact, we called it super because we think that’s the best word to describe Trader Joe’s latest, fruity, frozen treat! Even beyond the “super-fruit” status of strawberries, this Sorbet has other superb qualities going for it. Our supplier in Thailand starts with locally harvested strawberries that have a balanced, sweet & tart flavor, which translates sensationally when blended with water & cane sugar to form the smooth Sorbet base. Then, they add Strawberry pieces to amp up the texture and augment the Super Strawberry flavor.
Read More

title: DanishPrincessPastry
description:
When the weather heats up and turning on the oven loses its luster, you can still quell a craving for carbs with a visit to the bakery section at your neighborhood Trader Joe’s. You’ll find everyday staples like sliced breads, bagels, and tortillas, along with a seasonally rotating selection of muffins, cookies, and pastries—all for a fraction of the prices you might find elsewhere. Case in point: Trader Joe’s Danish Princess Pastry.
Read More

title: BeefRibEyeSteak
description:
At Trader Joe’s, our buyers travel the world in search of the best quality products at the best everyday prices for our customers. This commitment to value is evident across our offerings in general, and with Trader Joe’s Ribeye Steak, in particular. 
This 100% Angus beef comes to us from Argentina and Brazil, regions renowned for producing some of the highest quality beef in the world. The steers’ primary diet is supplied by the lush, low-lying grasslands of the South American Pampas, and is rounded out with corn and grain to impart the desired marbling in this boneless cut. Because marbling equals fat, and fat equals flavor, it follows that the quality of the finished Ribeye Steak boasts truly melt-in-your-mouth flavor, on par with anything you’d find in an Argentinian or Brazilian steakhouse— minus the steakhouse price tag, of course.
Read More

title: LemonHerbMacaroniSalad
description:
Modeled after a popular modern take on the classic recipe, Trader Joe’s Lemon Herb Macaroni Salad is not your grandmother’s mac. Of course, semolina elbow Macaroni anchors our chilled Salad in nostalgia, and the dressing mimics the creamy, mayo-based version of the past. Beyond these familiarities, though, the recipe departs for a new era, going lighter on the mayo and incorporating buttermilk, which hints at a tanginess that arrives in full with a cucumber, celery, and caper relish in a vinegar, white wine, and lemon juice brine.
Read More

title: VidaliaOnions
description:
“Onion,
luminous flask,
your beauty formed
petal by petal...”
-Pablo Neruda, Ode to the Onion
  It would be difficult to overstate just how important onions are to global cuisine. Nearly every culinary tradition the world over relies on onions in some form or another, and they often serve as the very bedrock of flavor that dishes are built upon. Noted for their sweetness, Vidalia Onions are a particularly essential allium, which is why we’re proud to offer them in convenient, two-pound bags during the spring and summer months.
Read More

title: WildCaughtBonelessGrilledSardinesinOliveOil
description:
In recent years, tinned fish has undergone what can only be described as a full-on reputational renaissance— and if you ask us, it’s about time! We’re doing our part to promote this resurgence in piscine appreciation with the introduction of Trader Joe’s Grilled Sardines in Olive Oil. They’re wild-caught for us off the coast of Tunisia, then their fillets are split down the middle and lightly grilled before being stacked and packed in olive oil. Out of the tin, each gloriously grill-marked Sardine is firm and meaty in texture, with a savory and delicately smoky flavor, ideal for enjoying as a protein for a quick meal, as part of an hors d’oeuvre spread, or as a hearty, anytime snack.
Read More

title: FrenchVinaigrettewithShallots
description:
A great salad dressing should accomplish three things: for starters, it shouldn’t be too thick—at that point, it’s just dip. Second, it should expertly complement your salad ingredients. And third, it should of course, be delicious. We’re delighted to report that Trader Joe’s French Vinaigrette with Shallots handily meets these salad dressing standards.
Sporting a signature tanginess courtesy of red wine vinegar and Dijon mustard, this French Vinaigrette with Shallots offers from-scratch flavor without the hassle that tends to accompany from-scratch preparation. Its subtle, sophisticated flavors and easily poured nature create a classic Paris bistro vibe wherever you splash it—on Little Gem Lettuce, in a marinade for chicken or fish, over of-the-moment veggies (think steamed Artichokes or grilled Zucchini), or in a picnic-ready pasta salad. (Give the bottle a good shake prior to use—just like a from-scratch dressing, you won’t find gums or thickeners here!)
Read More

title: ChickpeaFusilliPasta
description:
Looking for a high-quality gluten free pasta? Perhaps a pasta with a bit more protein? Or is fiber what you’re favoring these days? Trader Joe’s Chickpea Fusilli Pasta checks all these boxes—and more!
Constructed from a blend of chickpeas and tapioca flour, and formed into a classic corkscrew shape, this gluten free Pasta boasts an impressive 11 grams of protein and six grams of fiber per serving—yes! Just as impressive? The Pasta’s toothsome texture makes it an ideal partner to a tangy tomato sauce or creamy alfredo any night of the week, and it’s hearty enough to hold up in a pasta salad with TJ’s French Vinaigrette with Shallots, Marinated Grilled Artichoke Halves, and chunks of Prosciutto Wrapped Fresh Mozzarella Cheese.
Read More

title: SalsaVerdeChickenEnchiladas
description:
Our Crew works hard every day so that anyone who walks into their neighborhood Trader Joe’s can say, “This is not your average grocery store!” ‘Not your average’ means we’re committed to providing outstanding value in the form of the best quality products at the best everyday prices. And this approach extends across all the products in our stores, including Trader Joe’s Not Your Average Salsa Verde Chicken Enchiladas.
Read More

title: MeatlessMeatballs
description:
Can you have meatballs without meat? Trader Joe’s Meatless Meatballs answer with a resounding (and delicious) yes! So, if it’s not meat, what is it? We’re glad you asked. These Meatless Meatballs are expertly crafted from textured soy protein (TSP)—which is what remains after extracting the oil from soybeans. It’s “textured” because it has the appearance & mouthfeel of meat. It’s “protein” because it naturally contains a notable amount of protein—13g of protein per 4-Meatball serving.
Read More

title: PerfectBar®PeanutButterProtenBar
description:
According to his thirteen children, Dr. Bud Keith was a “health food guy” before “health food” was a thing, constantly tinkering with healthy recipes to feed his king-sized family. As the story goes, one day, he ground up a bunch of dried fruits and vegetables, mixed them with freshly ground nut butter and honey, took one bite and declared, “It’s Perfect!” –and with that simple exclamation, Perfect Bars® were born.
Read More

title: PerfectBar®DarkChocolateChipPeanutButterProteinBar
description:
According to his thirteen children, Dr. Bud Keith was a “health food guy” before “health food” was a thing, constantly tinkering with healthy recipes to feed his king-sized family. As the story goes, one day, he ground up a bunch of dried fruits and vegetables, mixed them with freshly ground nut butter and honey, took one bite and declared, “It’s Perfect!” –and with that simple exclamation, Perfect Bars® were born.
Read More

title: ProsciuttoWrappedFreshMozzarellaCheese
description:
The charcuterie board is always enticing, with its array of sliced meats and cheeses, prepped to be piled on assorted biscuits. As impressive as a board can be, the inventor of “rolloni” really took charcuterie snacking up a notch or two. Trader Joe’s first embraced this rolled charcuterie concept with our holiday Rolloni Meat & Cheese Tray, and we’ve now built on that product’s popularity with an everyday offering that we call Trader Joe’s Prosciutto Wrapped Fresh Mozzarella Cheese.
Read More

title: ClassicGreekSalad
description:
The traditional Greek salad is relatively new by ancient historical standards. It was apparently invented in the 1960s when Athenian restauranteurs skirted a tariff on essential salad items by adding non-taxable feta cheese to an already popular plate of cucumber, olives, onion, bell peppers, and tomato. Tourists ate it up. Literally.
Now, tourists of the culinary seas (aka our customers) have been eating up Trader Joe’s Classic Greek Salad since 2005—which may not be ancient, but certainly makes this Salad ‘classic’ by our historical standards! And to this day, it remains a tried & true mix of fresh, Greek-inspired ingredients that harken back to the Athenian original.
Read More

title: AllOccasionSprinkle
description:
If April showers bring May flowers, then what do April sprinkles bring? They bring Trader Joe’s All Occasion Sprinkle, that’s what! A carefully curated blend of classic jimmies, multi-colored “confetti,” and little hearts & flowers, it’s here to add visual appeal and textural interest to all your favorite sweet treats. Whether you’re baking a batch of birthday cupcakes, crafting a decadent dessert for a dinner party, or simply adding a touch of color and whimsy to your morning pancakes, it ups the fun-factor on All Occasions.
Read More

title: CeasarSaladwithSalmon
description:
Hail Caesar! This star of the salad world has conquered our hearts in countless variations, and the latest version to join our ready-to-eat ranks may just be the most exciting yet: Trader Joes Caesar Salad with Salmon! This tasty twist starts by shaking up the classic formula with a base of chopped kale in addition to the customary Romaine, then mixes things up further via the use of crunchy Parmesan cheese crisps instead of croutons. It’s finished with a hearty portion of grilled salmon, which, when mixed all together with the included creamy Romano Caesar dressing, creates a marvelous mix of savory flavors and toothsome textures that all combine into one seriously satisfying salad.
Read More

title: GlutenFreePizzaDough
description:
At Trader Joe’s, we believe that pizza is one of the great unifiers: no matter what your personal tastes, preferences, or diet may be, there’s a pizza out there that will work for you. And to support this belief, we’re committed to making sure that everyone has a chance to discover that pizza—even if you don’t eat gluten. That’s why we’re expanding Trader Joe’s Gluten Free Pizza Dough to be available in all of our stores, from coast to coast. Made with an ingenious mix that includes tapicoa starch, rice flour, and potato starch, this ready-to-bake Dough captures all the same pleasant chewiness of our standard Pizza Dough and Garlic & Herb Pizza Dough, all without containing a single gram of gluten.
Read More

title: Jumeokbap
description:
You’ve really got to hand it to jumeokbap. From the Korean “jumeok” (fist) and “bap” (rice), food historians estimate that this hearty, handheld dish has likely been a staple of Korean cuisine for thousands of years. Now a rising star in the global street food scene, jumeokbap can be made with any number of fillings and seasonings, and can be enjoyed in all manner of contexts: as a quick, on-the-go bite, as a side with a larger meal, or as a miniature meal all its own. Made for us by a supplier in the Republic of Korea, Trader Joe’s Jumeokbap are flavored with a mix of plant-based bulgogi and savory-seasoned vegetables, and take only about a minute in the microwave to go from frozen to soft, steamy, and ready-to-eat.
Read More

title: ShrimpScampi
description:
Shrimp, garlic, butter, lemon, and white wine. The ingredients to a classic shrimp scampi feel so made for one another, so iconic in their expression of flavor when combined, that it’s somewhat shocking to realize that the dish is only about a century old. In fact, when it was invented in Italy during the 1920s, it was simply known as “scampi,” and featured langoustine lobster, rather than shrimp. As delicious as that certainly was, we’re glad to be living in the era of the modern shrimp scampi we all know and love—an era which now includes the consummately convenient and phenomenally flavorful Trader Joe’s Shrimp Scampi, available in our freezers.
Read More

title: OrganicUncuredGrassFedBeefHotDogs
description:
Who doesn’t love the meaty bite, savorily seasoned character, and ease of preparation that characterize the hot dog—especially when backyard chefs begin firing up the grill. And when it comes to Trader Joe’s Organic Uncured Grass Fed Beef Hot Dogs, that love even extends to what goes into making this beloved tubular meat.
Generally speaking, hot dogs are notorious for containing questionable ingredients, but ours have an incredibly attractive and uncomplicated list of ingredients. The very first ingredient is USDA certified Organic Beef that comes from Grass Fed cows, yielding delicious flavor. You’ll also find sea salt and celery powder in the ingredients. These serve not so much as flavoring, but to effectively “cure” our Uncured Dogs, allowing us to leave out unwanted preservatives, such as nitrates & nitrites. What else goes into our Organic Uncured Grass Fed Beef Hot Dogs? The rest of the ingredients are all organic seasonings, things like garlic puree, minced onion, paprika, and red pepper flakes. No fillers. No kidding.
Read More

title: DarkChocolateCoffeeBuzzBar
description:
Coffee and chocolate are practically made for one another: both are rich, complex, and aromatic in complementary ways, with bracing, balanced bitter notes that play off of each other like a well-composed song. We sought to take this near-perfect pairing to new heights with Trader Joe’s Dark Chocolate Coffee Buzz Bars, four miniature-but-mighty chocolate bars made from roasted cocoa nibs and coffee beans from Colombia. Together, these two flavor powerhouses combine into one surpisingly smooth and creamy eating experience, that also happens to provide the same amount of caffeine as a shot of espresso in every Bar.
Read More

title: RedIslandAustralianExtraVirginOliveOil
description:
A typical olive harvest takes place over the course of three or four months, starting in mid-autumn and lasting through early winter. During that first month or so, the olives are still not quite fully ripe, so while it takes more of them to produce the same amount of oil as later-harvest olives, the oil that is produced tends to be much more flavorful—and, often, much more expensive, too. Unless, of course, you happen to be shopping at Trader Joe’s. Because for a limited time, we’re bringing in this super limited-edition Early Harvest Extra Virgin Olive Oil from the folks at Red Island® in Australia, and at a price that’s a fraction of what you’d pay for similar, early- harvest olive oil elsewhere.
Read More

title: Shredded3CheeseBlend
description:
Ever find yourself staring down the deli aisle not knowing what type of cheese you need that night? While we won’t help you select just one variety, we will hit you with Trader Joe’s Shredded 3 Cheese Blend which is bound to fit in with an assortment of different dishes. Whether your crafting an Italian themed dinner, a Mexican tinged meal, or just looking for a pre-made blend for your casseroles and pizzas, Trader Joe’s has your cupboard covered.
Read More

title: FreshCutPineappleChunks
description:
Tantalizingly sweet and puckery-tart, fresh pineapple has been so prized throughout its palate pleasing history that it became a symbol for hospitality. Our Fresh-Cut Pineapple is an apt ambassador for such hospitality. Raised under the watchful care of experienced pineapple growers (in the business for more than 115 years) in Costa Rica, the pineapples are picked when ripe and immediately cut and packaged—without the use of additives or preservatives—to ensure maximum freshness. The tart, sweet flavor and juiciness will delight, whether they’re enjoyed alone, blended in a smoothie or added to a fruit salad.
Read More

title: OrganicEnglishCucumber
description:
Allow us to wax poetic about Trader Joe’s Organic English Cucumbers. These are long, thin cucumbers with very few seeds and thin skins. Unlike most commercially cultivated cucumbers, these are not waxed, so you can eat the skin (you’ll want to give them a quick rinse, of course). We get a lot of questions about why they’re shrink-wrapped, and it’s directly related to their unwaxed nature. Once harvested, the shrink-wrap keeps them safe, and ensures consistent quality when you get them home.
Read More

title: GrilledChiliLImeChickenBreast
description:
Whether you’re making a quick weeknight dinner, putting together a weekend lunch, or meal-prepping for the week ahead, it’s always a good idea to have some pre-cooked chicken breast on hand. In addition to it being a positive powerhouse of protein, chicken breast is also incredibly good at holding on to all kinds of flavors, making it a potential powerhouse of flavor, too. Both of these aspects are particularly present in Trader Joe’s Grilled Chili Lime Chicken Breast, a longtime favorite of our Midwest stores, and that can now be found in our East Coast stores, too!
Read More

title: FreezeDriedRaspberries
description:
The process of freeze drying is a rather fascinating one—especially when applied to fresh fruit. In the case of Trader Joe’s Freeze Dried Raspberries, for example, it’s done by freezing ripe raspberries, then lowering the atmospheric pressure around them to near-vacuum levels. After this, they’re heated, which causes a curious reaction where the frozen water within the berries instantly transitions to a vapor, skipping the liquid phase entirely. And since raspberries are mostly water, what remains of each raspberry is super concentrated with their signature, sweet-tart flavor–in fact, it takes more than a half a pound of fresh raspberries to make each 1.2-ounce pouch of our Freeze Dried Raspberries.
Read More

title: MilkChocolateCoveredHoneycombCandy
description:
Honeycomb candy—or “sponge candy,” “seafoam candy,” or “cinder candy,” depending on what part of the world you’re in—is a classic confection composed of sugar, honey, and baking soda . Nowadays, most versions found at specialty candy shops or online (when you can find them, that is) aren’t actually made with honey—but they are accompanied by a formidable price tag. So you can imagine our delight when our product developer presented what is now Trader Joe’s Milk Chocolate Covered Honeycomb Candy to the tasting panel!
Read More

title: HummusDip
description:
One of our all-time favorite products is our Hummus. It’s versatile and tasty and we sell more of it than you can shake a chickpea at (grammatical faux pas notwithstanding, this statement is intended to reflect a tremendous amount of Hummus).
Our Hummus provides a big wow for such a small bean. What else is a wow? Well, our supplier uses only top-grade garbanzo beans, sesame tahini, garlic, lemon juice, and spices to make this Hummus that is full- flavored, completely vegetarian, and entirely satisfying.
Read More

title: SoySauceReducedSodium
description:
Everyone knows soy sauce is salty. It’s like the Asian-cuisine equivalent to a shaker of table salt. People use it liberally to add verve to all kinds of dishes, from stir-frys and noodle soups—to meats and vegetables. Just a little transforms bland white rice into something of a meal. And when it comes to recipes, it often serves as the base for sauces and marinades.
